Name: Black Seas: French Navy 3rd Rates of Renown
Description:
This box set outfits you with three French Navy Third-Rate-Ships-of-the-line. Building upon the superb third rate plastic sprues, the box contains additional metal components to make the following famous vessels, all of which were present at the Battle of Trafalgar!

Indomptable- A Tonnant-class 80-gun ship of the line, Indomptable was laid down in 1788 and saw active service from 1791. In her first engagement at The Glorious First of June she lost her mast and had to be towed back to Brest.

Under the command of Admirable Villeneuve she went to sea as part of a large fleet bound for the West Indies, but returned for Europe upon news that Nelson had arrived there. In the Battle of Cape Finisterre, a violent artillery exchange was halted by thick fog, an exhausted French fleet thus anchored in Ferrol before sailing on to Cadiz. Admiral Villeneuve, with his command under threat, vowed to meet the British at the Cape of Trafalgar.

At Trafalgar, Indomptable was part of the Spanish line, engaging Vice Admiral Collingwood's flagship HMS Royal Sovereign, as well as HMS Belleisle, HMS Revenge, HMS Dreadnought and HMS Thunderer. Drifting downwind, and out of range, she turned back towards Cadiz but got caught in a rescue operation for Bucentaure which had struck a reef. The following night, Indomptable was caught in a storm and carried onto rocks offshore from Cadiz. Only 150 (of between 100 and 1400 men) are estimated to have survived the wreck.

Formidable- an 80-gun Tonnant-class ship of the line of the French Navy, she was briefly named Figuieres, but this was restored to Formidable prior to her launch at Toulon on 31 May 1795. She participated in the Battle of Algeciras, the Battle of Cape Finisterre and the Battle of Trafalgar - in which she served as the flagship of Rear-Admiral Pierre Dumanoir le Pelley in the six-ship vanguard of the French fleet.

She was captured by the British at the Battle of Cape Ortegal on 4 November 1805. Renamed HMS Brave whilst in service of the Royal Navy, she was eventually sold to be broken up in 1816.

Argonaute- a 74-gun ship of the line of the French Navy. Under Vice-amiral Villaret de Joyeuse, she took part in the expedition to Saint-Domingue in 1802. She took part in the Battle of Trafalgar but managed to return to Cadiz. She could not leave port due to heavy damage and the British blockade, she was eventually exchanged for the Spanish ship Vencedor in December 1806. At this point, she was renamed Argonauta, but was never recommissioned.

—description from publisher

Name: Black Seas: Spanish Navy 3rd Rates of Renown
Description:
This box set outfits you with three Spanish Navy Third-Rate-Ships-of-the-line. Building upon the superb third rate plastic sprues, the box contains additional metal components to make the following famous vessels, all of which were present at the Battle of Trafalgar!

Monarca - a 74-gun third rate ship of the line belonging to the Montañés-class. Her main guns were arranged over two complete decks, with 28 24-pounder cannons on her lower deck and 30 18-pounders on the upper, in addition to 12 8-pounders and 4 8-pounders on her quarterdeck and forecastle respectively.

Under the command of Captain Teodoro Argumosa, she took part in the Battle of Trafalgar, in which she suffered heavy damage at the hands of HMS Bellerophon. 55 Royal Marines boarded and captured her, but one night later the survivors overpowered their captors and set them adrift in the storm. 3 days after the battle, the survivors had decided to attempt repairs to return to Cadiz but were pursued by HMS Leviathan (which had picked up the adrift marines). She ran aground on 28 October near Huelva and was destroyed by HMS Naiad to prevent her restoration.

Argonauta - an 80-gun third rate ship of the line, she was the last of the Montañés-class of ships (of which there were four). On 25 August 1800, she fought off the British Ferrol expedition as part of Joaquin Moreno's squadron.

Subsequently, she fought at the Battle of Cape Finisterre, and as part of Federico Gravina's second squadron at Trafalgar. Captured at the latter battle, she was taken in tow by HMS Poyphemus, but was abandoned due to the storm which followed the battle On 24 October HMS Defiance rescued survivors and attempted to re-establish a tow unsuccessfully. The Argonauta sank 6 days later, its survivors landing at Algeciras the next day.

San Justo - a 74-gun ship of the line, San Justo was launched 11 November 1779. She participated in such actions as the Battle of Cape St Vincent, and the Siege of Gibraltar. She later participated in the battle of Trafalgar, managing to escape destruction. She was eventually broken up at Cartagena in 1828.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Schooners Squadron
Description:
Schooners are two-masted vessels with both masts having loose footed sails rigged on gaff and two or more headsails (staysails rigged in front of the fore mast). They were not designed for combat, being built mainly for cargo, passenger and fishing purposes.

During the Napoleonic era, Schooners were used to communicate dispatches, rather than divert more important warships for this purpose. In fact their size and swiftness made them ideal for this purpose. Such vessels sometimes received criticism from the Admiralty for their sailing durability and inherent weakness, without understanding their exact purpose.

That is not to say that schooners did not actively engage in combat. Their speed made them ideal to intercept Slaver ships for example.

Schooners count as small vessels in Black Seas, operating only a single broadside light cannon. Despite this, schooners make the ideal basis of a Privateer fleet.

—description from publisher

Name: Black Seas: USS Essex
Description:
The USS Essex was a 36-gun frigate that participated in the Quasi-War with France, the First Barbary War, and the War of 1812. She was very successful in disrupting British whaling in the Pacific, before being captured in 1814, and re-purposed as the HMS Essex under the Royal Navy.

Launched on 30 September 1799, she was armed with short ranged carronades that could not hope to match the range of 18 or 24 pounder naval guns. The US Navy accepted her nevertheless and under the captaincy of Edward Preble, holding the distinction of being the first US Naval ship to cross the Equator in early 1800.

The first Barbary War saw duties shift to the Mediterranean, with blockading and convoy escort duties at Gibraltar as well as participating in the Battle of Deme (27 April 1805).

After the declaration of the War of 1812, USS Essex achieved major success in disrupting British whaling activities in the Pacific under the command of Captain David Porter. From February 1813, over the course of a year, Porter successfully captured 12 British Whalers, and 360 prisoners, whilst sailing around Cape Horn and cruising the Pacific.

However, On 28 March 1814 at the battle of Valparaiso, Porter was forced to surrender to the frigate HMS Phoebe and the sloop-of-war HMS Cherub when Essex became too disabled to offer any resistance. Of the 12 ships Porter had captured, only one returned to the United States; seven returned to British control, three were sunk, and the Chilean.

As HMS Essex, she was reclassed as a 42-gun ship, serving as a troopship in 1819, and hulked in 1823 to serve as a prison ship in Cork initially, and Kingstown from 1824 until 1834.

When used as part of a US Navy fleet in Black Seas, the special rules pay tribute to its successful run in capturing whaling vessels. When making boarding actions with the USS Essex, the benefits from a +2 modifier.

—description from publisher

Name: High Frontier 4 All: Module 1 – Terawatt & Futures
Description: Module 1 - Terawatt introduces two new patent decks: Freighters and GW Thrusters. Freighters are a new type of patent card allowing the transport of valuable factory goods back to Low Earth Orbit. GW Thrusters are more powerful and efficient versions of the MW Thrusters of the core game, allowing your Spacecraft to reach the outer planets more easily. This module also optionally introduces Futures which are special game goals to earn victory points.

Name: High Frontier 4 All: Module 2 – Colonization
Description: Module 2 - Colonization introduces orbital space colonies called Bernals and space pioneers called Colonists. These two types of cards extend the core game to go beyond industrializing and exploiting the resources of the solar system to colonizing and settling the solar system. Bernals upgrade your Colonies to give you extra Victory Points, according to the Hydration of nearby Factories. They also award Colonists, which you can take to Sites to perform extra Operations there.

Name: Chef de Char: Campagnes d'Afrique et d'Europe
Description:
Chef de Char is a beer and pretzel ruleset to simulate tank combats.
Each player represents a tank leader and gives orders to his crew, those are then executed.
For 10 to 28 mm minis
5-12 vehicles per side.
This version add corrections to v1 as well as additions for the War in North Africa
—description from the publisher (translated

Chef de Char est une règle rapide de combats entres blindés, simple à appréhender. La règle s'adresse autant aux joueurs confirmés qu'aux novices. Chaque joueur incarne, au moment où il active un de ses blindés, le chef du char actif. Il donne à son équipage des ordres qui sont ensuite exécutés. Une partie est jouable en 45 minutes par deux à quatre joueurs. 
La règle couvre les théâtres d'opérations d'Afrique du nord (1940/1943) et d'Europe (à partir de 43).
La règle décrit le profil des principaux chars utilisés sur ces théâtres d’opérations par les nations suivantes, France, Italie, Allemagne, Angleterre, USA, Russie.
—description from the publisher

Name: Wir fahren U-Bahn
Description:
The players have to get their trains (colored discs) from one end of a train line to the other. Movement is determined by a die. If a train gets on a cross section it has to change lines and the player has to try to get back to his original line.

The first player to get to the end of his line wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Balyna Baseball
Description:
A very rare and unusual game within the Balyna series of 1950s sports games. The main games were football and cricket however Balyna also produced baseball, tennis and golf games too.
Played on a roll out pitch with small plastic figures, a metal ball rolling chute and a metal batting gantry.
The highlight of the game is the superb marked out baseball diamond pitch.

—user summary

Name: Choirs Are Horrible: Choir Directors Only Expansion Deck
Description:
Choir directors, we know your singers are why you love what you do, and that they're also why you drink. This red-band, 54-card expansion deck is meant to be shuffled into the main card game to create a decidely more mature gaming experience. There's cussin', y'all. Hide it from the kids, someplace they won't ever look. Maybe the music library?

—description from the publisher

Name: Band Is Horrible: Band Directors Only Expansion Deck
Description:
Now in stock! Let's just say it: band directors can be horrible people. Who can blame them? They have to deal with that one damn freshman. They have to figure out why that mute is sticky. They have to wait until after school hours to get "band director drunk." This red-band expansion deck is meant to be shuffled into the main card game to create a decidely more mature gaming experience. There's cussin', y'all. Hide it from the kids, someplace they won't ever look. Maybe their instrument locker?

—description from the publisher

Name: Band Is Horrible: Band Assistant Directors Only Expansion Deck
Description:
Another Horrible Expansion Deck - Band Assistants Directors Only!- 54 brand new cards!- Adult content, juvenile humor- Ages 18+- If it were any more authentic, it would be just as good as the original Band Directors Expansion Deck, only cheaper to get. LMAO no, it's the same price: $16.99

—description from the publisher

Name: Choirs Are Horrible: Contemporary A Cappella Expansion Deck
Description:
Another Horrible Expansion Deck!
Contemporary A Capella! - A new expansion deck for Choirs Are Horrible

     54 brand new cards!
     High school appropriate
     Ages 14+
     Perfect for classrooms, tours, or when waiting whie they figure out where the feedback is coming from.


—description from the publisher

Name: Orchestras Are Awful: Orchestra Directors Only Expansion Deck
Description:
Orchestra directors can be horrible people, and with good reason. They drink because of F holes, and not the fun kind. This red-band, 54-card expansion deck is meant to be shuffled into the main card game to create a decidely more mature gaming experience. There's cussin', y'all. Hide it from the kids, someplace they won't ever look. Maybe their instrument locker?

—description from the publisher

Name: Le Jeu des Grosses Têtes
Description:
Based on a famous French radio (and TV) show. 
The game aim is to recreate the atmosphere of the show.

More than 2000 questions and general culture challenges.

6 types of questions:
Who said what ?
It's in what ?
Puzzle ?
Why's that ?
How much is it ?
Do you know !

Name: Death Ride Tarawa
Description:
This four day battle is one of the more gruesome fights in the Pacific Theater.  This game showcases a unique landing system.  While the fight to capture the island is not really 'in doubt', the Marines have a difficult time of wresting control of the place from the tough Japanese defenders.  The main battle campaign starts with the Marines aboard their transports.  From there they must move onto the landing craft and make their approaches to the beach.  The fire from the Japanese ashore is heavy and, as the Marines dicovered to their dismay, the reef causes a major disruption in the landing plan.  It also creates plenty of easy targets for the Japanese player to hammer.  Once ashore the Marines are going to be hammering away with everything they have and the dugin enemy positions are hard to eliminate.  Securing the island within 4 days is no picnic and playing it safe will not cut it.  The Marines need to be aggressive and willing to take casualties in order to move forward.

In the Landing system all Marines start on their transports.  When they become available on the Wave Chart they are loaded onto their landing craft.  From there they move to the Landing Craft Beach Chart.  From here the Landing Craft determine which hexrow of the beach lane they will enter the map.  This can cause some serious traffic jams.  Then the landing craft make their run ins' to the beach.  This is pretty exciting in itself, but then the Marines find wire and mine obstacles waiting for them in front of the sandy beach.  These cause major problems in landing.  The net result of all this is some very high nervousness about whether the Marines will get a solid bridgehead ashore.  The most problematic beach is RED 1.  The Marines here almost didn't make it and it is where the 'the Issue is in Doubt' quote comes from.  You will do better I'm sure.

There are some small scenarios, focusing on 1 beach, an intro scenario of the 2/8 Marines attacking on 22 Nov, and a 'what if' scenario should the Marine player decide to try his hand landing on the 'Black' beaches.  These beaches were located on the seaward side of the island and were covered by extensive minefields.  Good luck with that.

This game includes:
-(8) 11x17 map sections of Tarawa, (2) 22x34 map equivalents 34" across by 41" top to bottom
-5x Unit counter and marker sheets
-Death Ride - Tarawa Master and Supplemental Rules
-Charts and tables similar to other Death Ride games to support the system; and
-Charts that are specific to support the Amphibious Landing such as the Wave Chart and Transport Chart

-description from the publisher

Name: Blood and Valor: 28mm Historical Miniatures Game Set During World War One
Description:
Blood & Valor is a skirmish level game set during the conflicts of the Great War. 
Those of you who are familiar with Firelock Game’s previous game, Blood & Plunder, will feel at home with this game’s mechanics. Players deploy custom forces representing a Nationality, determine a scenario, and layout terrain to recreate one of the historical battlefields of the Great War.

A notable difference to Blood & Valor is the unique initiative system. Each round, players simultaneously and secretly bid points in order to determine who will act first. Strong forces can increase the number of points a player has to bid with, thus giving the player a better chance to act quickly. Players will take this into consideration when building their armies.

As always, our highest priority is historical accuracy and a large range of settings and options to choose from. 
The scope of this game is not limited to the western front! 
These rules allow for battlefields set in the Alps of northern Italy, the open spaces of the eastern front, the Gallipoli peninsula, and much more.

The choice is up to you and your imagination.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kingdoms: The Board Game
Description:
The player(s) travel around a modular board, unveiling different Landscape Tiles as they go. Different terrains allow you to build different buildings, such as a Forest being a good place to build a Sawmill. The player(s) gather various resources in order to expand their Kingdom and construct more advanced buildings.

As the player(s) progress, they will be able to recruit and equip an army to defend their newly forged Kingdom. This is necessary, as during the game they will also be drawing from a deck of cards. These cards will be of two different types; Enemy Cards and Event Cards. The former will detail the forces gathering at your borders, ready to invade, while the latter will add a little spice to your game in the form of random events. These range from mine collapses, fires, floods, plague or occasionally something not so bad.

Once the deck of cards has run out, the time for building is over. From that point on it is a do or die final battle against your enemies. Have you prepared enough to survive? Or will your Kingdom crumble to dust?

—description from the designer

Name: Amaze-A-Tron
Description:
Amaze-A-Tron is an electronic board game with eight variations that revolve around a hidden computer-generated maze. The board consists of a five-by-five grid of squares numbered 1 to 25.

At the beginning of the "Opposite Start" game variation, the computer selects a starting square (identified by number) for each player. The players then race to see who can get through the maze first and reach the opponent's starting square, through trial and error. The players alternate taking turns moving through the maze. A player can move through any number of squares until the player runs into a wall, at which point the other player gets to take a turn.

There are two solitaire maze games and six two-player games. In the "Blind Alley" variations, the maze includes dead-ends that force a player to backtrack to get back on the correct path. In the "Back to Start" variations, when a player runs into a wall the player's pawn is returned to the starting square, adding a memory element to the game. In the standard "Maze" game, both players start on the same square and are racing to reach the same destination square.

The plastic game board features a two-digit LED readout, red and green LED's (which correspond to the color of the opposing playing pieces), and a storage compartment for the four playing pieces (plastic pawns and start/finish space markers). A 9-volt battery or AC adapter is required.

—user summary

Name: Red Stars & Crosses: Eastern Front 1941 - 45
Description:
Red Stars and Crosses is an Eastern Front 1941-45 campaign expansion for Stars & Crosses Revised Edition 1.2, the game of WW2 company-level combat in 6mm scale.

You will need a copy of the core rules to play. 
This expansion includes rules for dust clouds, digging in, flares, antitank ditches, and extreme weather hazards.

Unit counters are included for Soviet units, plus new German units. Four scenarios are included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Histoire de France
Description:
The famous trivia game. The questions are about the French History.

There are 1800 questions divided in 6 periods of French history (Prehistory and Antiquity, Middle Ages, Renaissance to the Enlightenmen, XIX century, XX century and surprises.
Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

In French.

Name: Red Star, White Lights: Volume 1 of the Other Fire Series
Description:
In an alternate 1985, Soviet tanks rolled across the West German border…but that wasn’t the only battleground the Superpowers came to blows. 
One of these battlegrounds was Scandinavia. This scenario pack is Volume 1 of a new series meant to address the question “What is occurring in these “Other Fires” of the Third World War.
The scenarios cover tank battles, small commando raids meant to shape the fate of nations, and everything in between!

Contents of Volume 1:

     12 scenarios for a variety of rules systems (tested with Ambush Alley and Arc of Fire, but playable with any rules set) 
     Meticulously researched Squad and Platoon-level tables of organization and equipment for Norway, Sweden, and Finland, as well as the British Royal Marine Commandos and Soviet VDV, with input from the veterans themselves! 
     Suggestions for special rules meant to reflect the conditions of the far north.   
     Notes for where to find miniatures suitable for games with these scenarios!


Come explore some of the other fighting that might have broken out in a Third World War, and see what might have happened if the Red Star advanced south under the White Lights!

—description from the publisher

Name: U.A.Z.G. Unluckily Another Zombie Game
Description:
An evening like any other, in a quiet town, strange creatures suddenly began to appear. Nothing to worry about at the beginning but after a few hours the town was literally surrounded by these stinking and putrescing humanoid beings. And who has to save all the inhabitants? Obviously to one of the heroes like you! It doesn't matter if you are a neighborhood hooligan, a world-famous sports personage or an elderly lady skilled in gardening, THE TOWN NEEDS YOU!

In UAZG, each player plays an inhabitant of a small town hit by a zombie outbreak. The aim of the game is to reach the rescue teams, which appear after a certain number of game turns, depending on the number of players; very difficult mission without the character upgrade, an upgrade that can be obtained by completing the missions that will be available during the game.

UAZG is a Semi-Cooperative Zombie Game, this is because during the game you will have to cooperate to survive, but at the moment of the arrival of the rescuers maybe someone could have the brilliant idea of caring about the companions and saving the skin, since the rescuers will not have time to wait too long among thousands of zombies.
The game is based on the Pick-Up & Delivery mechanics and it will be essential to cooperate to complete the missions that will advance the 'Game Time'. Not doing any mission during a turn means advancing the 'Danger Marker' by a space that will lead after a few turns to fail and lose the game.
During the game there will be the level increases that will enhance the character of your choice and there will be the possibility of crafting useful objects or weapons, managing inventory better. In addition, there will be an opportunity to trade weapons with the heads of killed zombies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Taiping Era: Tabletop Wargame Rules for Land Conflict in 19th Century China
Description:
Taiping Era is a set of rules to cover conflict in China in the middle of the 19th Century. As such they are intended to cover both the Taiping Rebellion and the Opium Wars. It should be possible to fight both actions between native Chinese/Manchu forces such as in the early days of the Taiping Rebellion as well as actions involving full European forces and also the “Ever Victorious Army”.

Given this aim the rules must allow for armies of dissimilar size and armament. Chinese armies were well organised but had equipment and training substantially unchanged since the 17th Century when the Manchu Qing dynasty established itself in China.

—user summary
Families: History: Opium Wars and Taiping Rebellion

Name: Magic Maths
Description: Solve addition, subtraction and multiplication sums to fill your wizard board with yucky ingredients. Pick a card, solve the sum and rub the black star on the back of the card to magically reveal (and check) the answer. If it matches the number on one of your spell ingredients cards, add it to your board.

Name: Ellen's Games: You Bet Game
Description:
The You Bet game is a wildly funny game based on the You Bet Your Wife challenges seen on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games. One player sits behind the game unit with their head under a water container. Yup…you guessed it! If the person in the hot seat can't meet the number of items their teammate predicted they'd guess, they'll eventually get the drop! The container tips and dumps water on that player's head. Includes 100 double-sided category cards featuring lots of fun categories. The team that doesn't get wet wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ellen's Games: Danger Word
Description:
The Danger Word game is a wildly funny and unpredictable guessing game based on the Danger Word challenges seen on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games. Players choose a card and give teammates one-word clues hoping that they'll guess the Winning Word on the card…not the Danger Word. Who can get teammates to say "pool" but not "swim", or "infant" but not "baby"? Saying the Danger Word gets that player stamped with an X. Teams win by collecting 5 cards or if the other team gets 3 stamps.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ellen's Games Blindfolded Musical Chairs Game
Description:
Ellen's Games Blindfolded Musical Chairs Game


     INSPIRED BY THE ELLEN SHOW: This game of finding a seat while blindfolded is inspired by the Blindfolded Musical Chairs challenge played on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games



     DANCE IN PLACE: Players bust out their best dance moves to the music, while the host secretly places seats around them. Get ready for lots of laughs as players compete to find their seat



     DANCE, DROP, SEARCH: While blindfolded, players dance to the music, drop when it stops, then fumble around to find their seat. The game is over when one player claims the last seat


FUN PARTY GAME: Fans of The Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games can give any party a boost with this Blindfolded Musical Chairs game. It's great fun for friends and family ages 10 and up

Love Ellen's Games? This Blindfolded Musical Chairs game is a laugh-out-loud, active game inspired by the hilarious musical chairs challenge she plays on TV. One player is in charge of the music and setting up the disc-shaped seats. The other players put on blindfolds, and bust out their best dance moves when the music starts. When the host stops the music, players crawl around to find a seat. Anyone left without a seat is out. Repeat until 2 players are left and only 1 finds the last seat!

—description from the publisher

Name: No Freakin! Way
Description: No Freakin Way! is a hilarious game where you discover just how well you know your friends and relatives. You'll be surprised at what they'll do for a buck! A player is presented with a crazy scenario, then the other players at the table can add to the scenario, making it even crazier. Then the original player must decide just how much-or how little-it would take to perform the challenge. All other players try to guess the amount the original player has chosen-using poker-like chips valued from one dollar all the way to "No Freakin Way!" Everyone reveals their best guess the same time. Those who guess correctly, get "gems". The player with the most "gems" at the end is the winner.

Name: Ancient Pub Battles
Description:
Ancient Pub Battles is a Military Strategy Game where you can fight the battles from the 2nd Punic Wars virtually anywhere.  It pits Rome vs Carthage.  Scipio Africanus vs Hannibal.

The game is played with blocks marking infantry and cavalry on an open field with no terrain. Movement is measured with distance marker sticks, and combat is resolved with a simple dice pool mechanism.

Games last for up to 8 turns, and movement order is determined through a chit pull mechanism. When a general’s chit is pulled, he may command armies in range or contact. Players may defer or jump in the turn order by rolling against a command rating for their generals on the field.

Players may choose from four included historical scenarios, or build armies with a point system which also determines the winner of a battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Uber Soldat!: For The Fatherland! Expansion
Description:
On the Frontline, the Germans have a new weapon...the new Machine Krieger! First the Allies saw the MK.I Uber Soldat but did not know that it was just to keep the Allies busy until the new MK.IIs arrived.

The Uber Soldat is now on the move, armed with the new MG45g and firing heavy caliber rounds which are able to penetrate buildings, trees, and walls. Or the new flamethrower, which is also able to fire a toxic gas as well as flames! Nowhere is safe on the battlefield when the MK.IIs arrive!

Now you can reinforce your German forces with some hard-hitting fire power and hit your enemies hard to take Germany back--For the Fatherland!

—description from the publisher

Name: Kwiatki i Rabatki
Description:
Fast and easy game for kids and parents.
In the game you have to create your own flower garden taking tiles and adding them to your existing flower beds in domino-like manner.

Game consist of 48 square tiles with four flower-beds each (this number includes three special tiles – a pond, a gnome and a rock – which can be placed anywhere). At the reverse site each tile has a number from 1 to 4, that indicates how many different flower types this tile is composed of (number 1 means that the tile has all four flower beds of one type, while number 4 shows, that each of triangle-shaped flower bed is of different type).
Players will draw covered tiles in turn trying to arrange most beautiful garden, however look out! As new tile can be placed next to already owned tile only if it shares the same flower type along the same edge (special tiles are treated as “blanks” and can be placed at any place). Players will continue the game, until all tiles are drawn.
At the end of the game, players count their score:
total player’s score = number of triangular areas in their single biggest closed flower bed + number of tiles in their biggest filled rectangular shaped area within their garden.
Player with the most points wins.

Name: Lody!
Description:
Easy fact game for kinds and parents.
Easy game where you have to create your ice cream cone by drafting ice cream scoops of different flavour (required colours) and with decorations (different point value).

Name: Shadow Gates
Description:
Presentation on Essen Spiel 2021

Shadow Gates is an asymmetrical card-based boardgame for 2 to 4 players.

The action takes place in an age of constant clan wars in an alternative-history 16th century Japan.
Aiming to make their warriors invincible, ambitious warlords turn to forbidden magic: shadow gates. The gates lend unhuman strength to the warlords and their armies, while distorting their bodies and their minds. The corruption streams forth from the gates, consuming more and more provinces.
The few remaining clans have to unite to make a stand against the forces of darkness.

The players will side with one of the warring factions: the Keepers of the Gates or the Free Clans.
The game is utilizing the following features: hidden agenda, territory control and hand management. Each side has its own unique asymmetrical card-based mechanics for performing actions: moving forces, conducting rituals, initiating battles, building defences etc. The objective of the game is carrying out personal hidden agendas. The game uses highly detailed miniatures and a large playing board.

Name: Pot the question
Description:
The ultimate question game with over 100,000 questions.
Answer the grades questions to "pot" the balls - 1 point for a red upto 7 points for a black. "pot as many balls as possible to out "pot" your opponents.  Choose the degree of difficulty of questions according to your own knowledge over a wide range of subjects.

Name: House of Cards
Description:
The game is set in a haunted house. Cards are used to represent different rooms of the house, and players explore and react to events that take place in the rooms.

House of Cards requires a token for each player, 2 decks of standard playing cards (jokers optional), and 3 sets of tokens (50 "ghost" tokens, 26 "relic" tokens, and 75 "luck" counters).

One deck is shuffled, with about half the cards (chosen randomly) facing up, then dealt in a grid (the larger the grid, the longer the game). Cards are given relic and ghost tokens based on their suit. The second deck is shuffled normally and hands are dealt to the players.

The player can play cards to collect "luck" counters, move through the house, discovering rooms, collecting relics, and fighting ghosts and other players. Once the target number of relics are collected, the winner is decided.

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Wakakusa Yamayaki
Description:
An Experience promo card that was given to all backers of the The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences Kickstarter-campaign.

This was added in  December from their KS update #21
We thank you for your patience and understanding of this issue. We are really sorry for this small and yet significant delay. As a "thank you for your patience" we decided to include one more brand new Experience promo card in everyone's package

As for availability:
It will be made available in the future for our Essen backers as well. We will post an update about it.

Name: With Sword and Shield: Fantasy Mass Combat Rules
Description:
With Sword and Shield is a miniatures game of mass combat, set in any world you wish to imagine! 
Field armies composed of unruly hordes, stalwart men-at-arms, thundering cavalry, fantastic creatures, gigantic constructs, great war engines, powerful wizards, iconic heroes and brave leaders in an attempt to crush your opponents on the field of battle.

The game uses simple differential mechanics to determine combat outcomes, and pass/fail/critical failure gradients for casting spells. 
Casualties are removed in ranks, or individual bases for characters, and units that fails to recover from Command Hits may rout from play.

With Sword and Shield supports miniature scales from 3mm up to ‘heroic’ 28mm, and includes:

     Rules reflecting troop order, formations, and maneuvers
     Provisions for horde, skirmish, elite, large and enormous creatures, flying, constructs and war engine unit types
     Characters in the form of Leaders, Heroes, Mages, Wild Mages, Necromancers and Ecclesiasts
     Dozens of unit and character attributes that create a unique feel and purpose for each unit in play
     87 Spells and Rituals with which to harass and destroy your enemies
     Six standard scenarios, scalable to the size of game you wish to play
     An average game length of 2-3 hours.
     Complete rules and guidelines for creating your own units and armies
     Six complete army lists to get you started playing right away – Elves, Humans, Dwarves, Orcs, Beastmen and Undead – plus unit profiles for summoned creatures and elementals
     Game reference charts, markers, and blank unit cards for your own creations


—description from the publisher

Name: Close Quarters: Skirmish
Description:
SpecOps missions. Prisoner rescues. Data retrieval. Ambush the enemy, sabotage his equipment and installations. Completing your mission is critical; any casualties are acceptable.

Close Quarters: Skirmish, based on our boardgame of the same name, is a fast-paced SciFi miniatures game of small-scale combat operations, suitable for 15mm to 28mm figure scales. 
Each model represents an individual trooper, vehicle, or crewed weapon; 
game sizes can range from 12 to 50-60 models (a reinforced platoon of infantry, or a cross attached armored or airborne company), and last from 45 minutes up to a couple of hours.

During each game turn, players activate a variable number of models in one of four segments (couplets) in an effort to complete each mission’s objectives – or to prevent their opponent from completing his. 
The game includes:

     Easy to play game mechanics, with most functions resolved by the roll of a single die.
     Basic rules for infantry, support weapons, vehicles, crewed weapons, and indirect fire (including off-board artillery)
     22 optional rules for players wanting a more detailed or varied game
     Dozens of weapons, troop attributes, and vehicle systems to choose from Field officers, NCOs, snipers, hackers, sappers, MBTs, tank destroyers, IFVs, VTOLs, antitank guns, power armor troopers, and a number of possibilities for some very non-human opponents
     11 standard scenarios that scale in both table size and number of game turns depending on the forces chosen for use by each player
     A campaign game system that allows your men to improve over the course of the conflict
     Complete rules for creating and fielding forces of your own design
     Four pre-generated forces, representing human and alien factions in the late 25th century, along with TO&E and unit stats for each
     Two playable sample campaign game forces
     Blank, edit-enabled troop/vehicle and campaign game roster PDF forms
     All necessary game markers, templates, and charts


Whether your mission takes place in an industrial complex, in the open field, or within the confines of a starship’s corridors, Close Quarters: Skirmish places the success or failure of each mission into the most capable hands: yours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Close Quarters: Infestation
Description:
Close Quarters: Infestation allows players to re-create the overrun of the Earth Protectorate research outpost Contego by a previously unknown alien race, the Llysa'ath.

This Close Quarters module includes:

     New terrain rules, including outdoor terrain such as trees, depressions, bushes, and low walls;
     Rules for operating the Llysa'ath, a reptilian peoples with four distinct classes of troopers;
     A section on Night Fighting, plus new equipment specifically for use in dark environments;
     5 new scenarios depicting the action in and around Contego Base, some of which occur across multi-level scenario maps;
     15 pages of new room and corridor tiles rendered at 300dpi, including bonus tiles not used in the enclosed scenarios, and new counters and markers for the Llysa'ath;
     Guidelines for converting Close Quarters into a 15mm- or 28mm-based tabletop miniatures game, including tabletop measuring templates and a point-based troop builder to help balance your miniatures-based scenarios.


The CARDS print product option contains all of the game counters, charts, markers, room and corridor tiles pre-printed on 8.5" x 11" heavy stock sheets, ready to be mounted on backer board (or used as they are), to play all of the scenarios from this Close Quarters module.

—description from the publisher

Name: Strike Legion: The VICAR Project
Description:
The first time I saw one was when I was evacuated from the Death Valley camp. I didn’t get to see it up close; since it wasn’t one of ours, that’s probably a good thing - I’d already be dead. It was probably 5-6 miles away from my vantage point, and it looked like a city block had sprouted treads and guns and started moving. I later learned that these weren’t proper VICAR units - there weren’t any in the initial invasion force - but VIPRs, and that some VICAR units are even larger.

The VICAR Project is an expansion for use with the Strike Legion Tactical gaming system that introduces Oversized Vehicles into your tactical gaming battles, along with rules for campaign gaming using the Strike Legion Tactical system. Included in this volume:

     Complete rules for using Oversized Vehicles (Signatures -5 to -12 in game terms), along with construction routines for creating your own monster tanks
     74 Data Cards representing some of the VICAR, VIPR and conventional combat equipment and personnel units of the North American Union, the Russian Federation, and the People’s Republic of China for use in tabletop games set in an alternate near future
     Complete rules for map-based Campaign Games involving ground, naval, air and space-based support forces, including guidelines for resolving combat actions, simple supply rules, and refitting the troops between battles
     3 Campaign scenarios: Highland Battle, Ringworld, and Archipelago, with each scenario progressively introducing additional campaign gaming elements
     Two sample Campaign Game force rosters with complete force lists for use in the Highland Battle Campaign Scenario
     Multiple optional rules for players wanting to incorporate a little more detail into their campaign games
     34 additional Data Cards and force organization information for three of the forces introduced in the Strike Legion Tactical Rules Compendium (the Earth Protectorate, the 5th Russik mercenary force, and the alien Derali) that provide more rounded forces for use in the Campaign Scenarios included in the book
     9 new tactical battle scenarios that can be called into use under specific Campaign Game situations, or played as stand-alone scenarios
     Various Campaign Game forms, markers and charts
     Many hours of enjoyable, intense gaming experiences with your gaming group


—description from the publisher

Name: Quaggle
Description:
Quaggle is an exciting, fast paced and extremely addictive balancing game. Place, interlock or hook your piece and stack your way to the top. One wrong move could send the structure tumbling. Made of solid wood.

NEVER GETS BORING! Guaranteed not to collect dust in your closet. Hook it, lay it, interlock it, or hang it, place your piece by any way imaginable. Every structure is unique every game is different. Picture worthy every step of the way.
GAME PLAY: Take turns drawing cards and stack the piece shown, one by one the structure will grow until one person sends it all crashing down! Get the free Quaggle Timer App (iOS and Android) and unlock the full game’s potential.

Exciting gameplay for up to 12 people.

Quaggle is an engineering masterpiece combining art, design and physics to create the ultimate stacking game. This deluxe game is made for all ages, young and old. Improves hand-eye coordination and develops fine motor-skills. Award winning (Mom’s Choice Awards Recipient) Gold Award. STEM and STEAM game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Task Force Zeta: Volume One – Ships of the Line
Description:
Task Force Zeta is a game of starship combat set in any future you wish to imagine! Fight ship-on-ship duels with the enemy or engage entire fleets in battles of 50-60 ships per fleet - and finish the battle in anywhere from 30 minutes to an afternoon's gaming time.

The rulebook is divided into easy-to-learn sections and uses a form of programmed instruction, allowing players to apply newly-learned rules sections over the course of seven scenarios - begin playing the game in as little as 15 minutes!

Task Force Zeta Volume One: Ships of the Line includes:


    Basic, Inertial, and Gravitic starship movement drives;
    Eleven distinct weapons classes, each having a different effect against the enemy's six different types of ship's armor and shields;
     Four basic types of torpedoes and drones;
     Integrated Electronic Warfare rules that are simple to execute but leave players with difficult choices each turn;
     A simple Power Management option to adjust each ship's combat, defense, and movement capabilities.
     Support for fighters and carrier operations;
     Multiple optional rules;
     A couple dozen ship and fighter designs for use in the enclosed scenarios;
     Complete construction rules that allow for literally hundreds of basic fighter and ship hull configurations - before adding systems and weapons.
     On-line support in the form of free fleet list downloads for fleets from popular SciFi media sources and select miniatures manufacturers;
     Lots of decompressive, explosive fun!


Task Force Zeta scales combat at 1 miniature equals one ship or a squadron of fighters/shuttles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Task Force Zeta: Volume 2 – Fleet Auxiliaries
Description:
You've learned how to defeat your enemies on the distant borders of The Empire, commanded powerful warships and fighter wings in battle, and lived to tell your tales in the officer's lounge. But none of your accomplishments would have been possible were it not for a plethora of supporting troops, supply tenders, repair vessels, and starbases along your route to the enemy's front door. Time to give them their due.

Task Force Zeta Volume Two: Fleet Auxiliaries brings these forces and more to your tabletop space battles. This volume includes:

     Numerous optional rules, including boarding combat, ramming attacks, combat/long-range scouts, docking, towing, explosions, shipboard fires, and more!
     New classes of vessels, including starbases and ground installations, transport ships and shuttles, Exosuit and Mecha-based fighter squadrons, and Oversized vessels that have no theoretical limit in their size and capacities during their construction.
     Six new weapon characteristics that expand the capabilities of existing weapons classes, Unconventional Weapons to conduct specific forms of electronic attacks against the enemy, mine warfare rules, and Organic ship hulls to represent bio-mechanoid ships.
     29 new and expanded systems that can be added to ships of any size, including teleporters, tractors beams, grappling hooks, troop, cargo, and passenger bays, deployment systems for troop transports, and more. A number of new systems are geared towards preparing your vessels for campaign-style gaming.
     Rules for interacting with planetary bodies, wormholes, jumpgates, and combat in hyperspace (which is always a risky undertaking).
     Construction section additions that allow players to create ships using all of the new options, keeping Task Force Zeta at the forefront of space combat games with the largest number of possibilities for unit creation.
     50 new pre-designed vessels, including a selection of ships from two original forces - the Omani Imperium and the Rikai'ishi'i Empire.
     Six new tactical scenarios that include pirate attacks against convoys and Q-ships, weapons testbeds, salvage operations, starbase assaults, and more!
     Complete rules for running a tactical campaign game, including a fully-developed campaign scenario with attendant map. A blank star sector map for creating your own campaign game set-ups is also included.
     A section devoted to Joint Strike Operations, allowing players to run planetary invasion scenarios by combining Task Force Zeta with our popular Strike Legion tactical game series, and a complete Joint Strike Operations scenario featuring the Omani vs. the Rikai'ishi'i in space and on the ground. New Strike Legion Data Cards to represent a portion of these forces are also included.
     A secondary download containing the basic background information, Data Cards, and ground unit formations for the Omani and Rikai'ishi'i from Strike Legion: Skunk Works.


—description from the publisher

Name: Task Force Zeta: Fleet Pack 1 – Flesh and Steel
Description:
Task Force Zeta: Flesh and Steel pits the forces of mankind's United Colonies against the Cyberon, a race of mechanical constructs, in sweeping fleet engagements across the known universe. 
This Fleet Pack includes:

     A background history that describes the basic setting and the conflicts of the First and Second Wars between the United Colonies and the Cyberon;
     Data Cards for 37 capital and escort vessels, along with a dozen fighter and shuttlecraft, in a new (and far more attractive) data card format;
     A section with basic descriptions of each ship and fighter class in this Fleet Pack, along with availability charts for fighting pick-up games with 'historically accurate' forces;
     A short selection of special rules to better reflect this universe (that can also be adopted for any game of Task Force Zeta);
     Two battle scenarios;
     Two Tactical Campaign Games, including a CG map, terrain notes for each of the 22 star systems on the map, and the addition of simple resource management to replace fleet losses during a Tactical CG;
     Suggestions on where to find appropriate miniatures to better reflect the vessels of the combatants on your tabletop.


—description from the publisher

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: King Dan
Description:
Additional Apprentice Card released during the Game Boy Geek Kickstarter.

King Dan - As an action, you may discard a Building Plan to Destroy 1 Debt.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Paladins of the West Kingdom: King Dan
Description:
Additional Townsfolk Card released during the Game Boy Geek Kickstarter.

King Dan - Any time you dismiss a Townsfolk Card, also discard 1 Suspicion.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: King Dan
Description:
Additional Townsfolk Card released during the Game Boy Geek Kickstarter.

King Dan - Immediately gain any 1 resource when placed onto your Player Board.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Gott í skóinn
Description:
An Icelandic Christmas game where you play as all of the Icelandic Santas (Yes, ALL of them, which means around 80)
In this game, you either give out shoes, or presents, and your goal is to get "rid" of all your presents.
In the beginning everyone gets a certain amount of presents they want to get rid of.
Then, during the game you draw cards, you either get a santa or a shoe, if you get a shoe you put your shoe in front of you and the next player may be able to give as many of his presents as he wants, the player can also give someone else his presents, or distribute them evenly.
If you get a santa, you are able to give out the number of presents that santa gives (maybe 3, maybe only 1)
First one to give out all his presents, wins. Unless, right before he does it, he is slammed with a NOPE card that can be given by any player at any given time. The NOPE card features the Santas's father.

Name: Race The Rails
Description:
A quick-fire game of searching, moving and forfeits...but keep your elbows in!

Players are given a starting station and must then find it on one of the 36 journey cards (each has four stations): the entry will tell them the time of their next train and where it will take them (to be noted). Eventually, each player will see that their next station stop is HOME...those first home, with the most money, will win the game.

However, would that it were so simple! Along the way you may be accosted for your ticket, required to chase your connection, help other players on _their_ journey and/or enjoy a well-earned cup of tea (or even lunch!).

Race the Rails is an exhilarating game of speedy observation and dexterity for up to twelve simultaneous players.

—description from the publisher

Awards etc:
2020 - Nominated (finalist) for a Mojo Nation Play Creators Award - Game Designer of the Year (Licensed Product)
2022 - Short-listed for Gift of the Year Award - Branded Gift

Name: Mars Memorandum: A Solitaire Strategic Game About Mars Colonization
Description:
"Mars is there, waiting to be reached."
Buzz Aldrin
Live the dangers and challenges of colonizing Mars in our Mars Memorandum strategy game!

Mars Memorandum is a solitaire strategic game, where it simulates the creation of a colony in Martian soil. The main objective of the player is to develop and maintain a population of 2000 settlers despite the problems and possible natural events.

Game Components:

     1 Rules booklet
     1 board with Mars map
     1 Recon Manual
     Resource and Facilities Markers
     General Control Board of the Colony
     1 player aid
     3d models for print


You need also 1 six-sided dice (d6). You can borrow from another game.

Mars Memorandum is a game of resource management, reasoning and luck. 
The goal is to build and maintain a Martian colony for 2000 inhabitants in 30 game turns. The player should rely heavily on his reasoning to develop the full potency of the colony in all its aspects.

Name: Machete: The Game
Description:
Machete The Game was born from an idea of the histrionic artist Immanuel Casto who involved Machete Productions to create an irreverent and satirical card game about the music world, played by those who live in it every day as its protagonist. The game includes almost 100 cards designed by Diego Flower Boscolo. Each player impersonates one of the rappers of the Machete crew: SALMO, NITRO, DJ SLAIT, JACK THE SMOKER, RASTY KILO, KILL MAURI and HELL RATON. Between albums to produce, scandals and hits, build the Pyramid of the Machete Empire, block the climbs of your opponents and become the King of the music world. Your goal in the game is to become a successful rapper, expanding your empire. The first to complete his Empire pyramid, placing the tenth card on top of the pyramid, wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

RULES

Setup:

     Create a draw deck shuffling together the Empire and Performance cards.
     Every player chooses/gets a member of the Machete crew and collect the respective starting money and resources.
     Every player as starting hand draws 4 cards (the order does not matter)


Round 4-phases:

     Every player draws a cards from the draw deck.
     Everyone chooses a card to reveal at the same time, then players can take their turn in order, based on the card's initiative value. The player can sell the card (discard it and get money) or play it. When the player plays the card, he/she pays the money cost and/or check its resource requirements, then if it's an Empire card he/she adds it to his/her pyramid tableau, while if it's a Performance card it just get discarded after applying its effect. If a player doesn't have all the resources required to play a card, he/she can ask another player for help and pay money in exchange for the favor.
     Every player picks a card to pass face down to the player on his/her left.
     Players choose what to discard to get their hand to a max of 7 cards.


Winning condition:
The first player to complete his/her pyramid tableau, placing the 10th card (base of 4 cards + second level with 3 + third with 2 + 1 last card on the top), immediately wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Endangered: Giant Panda Scenario
Description:
The march of humankind’s progress threatens the survival of Giant Pandas. It's up to you and your team to save them!

Work with your fellow conservationists to save Giant Pandas from extinction and create a sanctuary.

This is an expansion for Endangered.

Name: Children's Forte Trivia Cards
Description:
The third set of trivia cards in the Forte line. The box contains a playing guide, a six-colored die, and 363 trivia cards (2,178 questions). It's designed to be played on its own, or with "other popular trivia games".

The categories with corresponding color are: Green - Fun & Games, Orange - History & People, Blue - Fairy Tales & Legends, Brown - The Sciences, Pink - Music, Movies, & TV, Yellow - Fair Play.

Name: Little Ghosts
Description: Little Ghosts is a memory game where players take turns trying to find as many matching ghosts as possible. There are some added twists to the game though. Poltergeists will block your turn and magical spell books will let you mess with other players in the game, plus much more!

Name: Venture
Description: In Venture, you take control of  one of six companies, and you play against other players in a financial race to be the first one to expand. But watch out! The stock market is going up and down all the time. Manage and invest your income wisely turn by turn and take the number one spot as Leading company!

Name: Greedy Gobblers
Description:
The goal of the game is collect the most blobs with your greedy gobbler.

To start the game, players throw the numbered die to determine the first player with the highest roll. The first player begins by rolling both dice at the same time. They will then move up to the number of spaces shown on the dice along the colored line shown on the dice. After they are done moving, pass the dice to the next player in clockwise order.

Greedy Gobblers can move in any direction. They must remain on the line of the indicated color shown on the die unless they roll a “Smiling Joker”. This will allow you to move the Greedy Gobbler on any colored line.

One thing to watch out for is rolling a “Sad Joker”. If this happens, the player unfortunately loses their turn.

Players can move their Gobbler fewer steps then shown on the dice. This can potentially help them collect more Blobs on their next turn.

If there aren’t any blobs on the colored line rolled, the player must move the total amount of spaces shown on the numbered die.

Greedy Gobblers block a player's path. If there is a Gobbler in your way, you cannot move past the one in front of you.

When all the Blobs have been collected, Players all open up their Greedy Gobblers and count up the total number of Blobs. The player with the most Blobs is the winner.

Name: Nephite Temples
Description:
Can you help the Nephites build their temples? Sounds easy, right? Not so fast! You have to deal with Demolition, Mix-ups, Earthquakes, and a host of other problems and hilarious fun to get the job done. But work quickly; complete your temple first and you win!

—description from the box

Players will take turns rolling a die and playing cards.  The die roll determines which actions players may take. All of the available actions are listed on each player's ROLL CARD and PLAY CARD. Play continues as players build their temples by laying down the correct combination of cards in a pyramid.

Winning the Game: Be the first player to finish building a temple that is all the same color and you win.

—user summary

Name: Listas las Listas
Description:
Listas las listas is a game about making lists. The deck has 50 cards, of which 5 contain different game modes, 20 have nouns and 25 have characterics. In each round, a set of three cards is drawn, and then players create lists according to the current game mode card - lists of things that match the other two cards. Game modes include: Making an especially unusual/fun/long list, alternating in adding things to the list until a player can't add anything anymore, and others. 
For each game mode, there are rules about how to score points. There is no defined end condition or even the need to keep score, but you can do that if you want to determine an overall winner in the end.

Name: Red White & Blue Racin': Stock Car Racing Pioneers Card Set
Description: Adds 55 drivers represented in full-color standard and TV cards, depicting vintage vehicles, based on the early days of stock car racing. Also includes set of 32 black-and-white Track Cards based on actual 1950s racing venues and revised era-specific Race Week TV and interview charts.

Name: INKAS: The Legend
Description:
Based on the legendary history and mythology of the Inka Empire, Inkas: The Legend is a strategy board game for 2 to 4 players that takes you back to a mystical time of spirits, monsters, and dragon-like Amarus, where you must battle gods and enemy nations for the chance to become the founder of a NEW empire.

The game represents the legend of the Ayar siblings and the creation of the Inka Empire. In this legend, the almighty god creator Wiraqucha gives his children, Ayar Manqu, Mama Uqllu and their siblings, a magical gold staff named the Tupayauri. With it, they travel across the future Tawantinsuyu, searching for the perfect land to found the Inka Empire.

In this game, players first race for the Tupayauri at the center of the board, then they try to steal it from each other. The Tupayauri is needed to be able to conquer a wamani (province). Once a wamani is conquered, its hidden "Pacha Card" is revealed. Within one of the 12 peripheral wamanis, the Qusqu (Cusco) card is hidden. Whoever finds Qusqu or defeats all enemy warriors, wins the game.

There are 5 different ayllus (clans), with 5 type of warriors each: A Guide, a Scout, a Fighter, a Hunter, and a Shaman, each with special abilities needed in the game.

The game also showcases llama pieces, which serve to energize attacks and as offerings to the god Wiraqucha.

INKAS: The Legend currently has rulebooks in English and Spanish, and a Quechua version is forthcoming. Quechua is the main language of the Inka Empire, still spoken by 10 million people in South América.

—description from the designer

Name: Battles of the Seven Years War: Austria versus Prussia
Description:
Pitched battles were the essence of the Seven Years War. Who hasn't been stirred by Frederick's extraordinary victory over the Austrian host at Leuthen, or his shattering defeat at Kolin? 
You cannot understand the Seven Tears War without battles, and so we offer this first of two studies of the essential actions of Frederick the Great's most important war.

Lobositz - 30 September, 1756
Prague - 6 May, 1757
Kolin - 18 June, 1757
Rossbach - 5 November, 1757
Leuthen - 5 December, 1757
Hochkirch - 14 October, 1758
Liegnitz - 15 August, 1760
Torgau - 4 November, 1760
Freiburg - 28 October, 1762
Each battle includes a historical summary, detailed battle map, notes on game representation of terrain, deployment, game length, and victory.

A detailed game order of battle is of course provided. It also serves as a game roster sheet and is intended to be photocopied by the players and used during the game. The order of battle gives you as much information as possible about the armies. Often game units are made up of several historic units, and wherever possible those historic units are noted.

Regardless of what rules systems you enjoy, BATTLES OF THE SEVEN YEARS WAR is an indispensable game and historical resource. Look for its forthcoming companion volume, covering the battles with the Russians, German allies, and French.

Name: Airship race round the world
Description:
Roll-and-move boardgame themed around a circumnavigation air race. The centre of the board features a world map, highlighting the British Empire, and shows a race route form Melbourne to London via SE Asia and the Middle East, and returning to Melbourne via the Americas and East Asia. The actual game track is around the edge of the board, and consists of 60 spaces. 18 spaces feature vignettes of famous cities along the route, with penalties or bonus to apply to the players landing on them.

—user summary

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Stormcast Eternals: Sacrosanct Chamber
Description:
Warriors who channel the magical energies of Sigmar through potent weapons, the Stormcast Eternals of the Sacrosanct Chamber turn their attentions to the Chaos-infested Bloodwind Spoil and the foul denizens that call it home.

Harness the mystical power of the Sacrosanct Chamber with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, the cards in this set enable you to restore some semblance of order to the Chaos-infested wastes. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of 12 fighter cards provide profiles four types of Evocators, two types Castigators and six types of Sequitors.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Rolling Freaks
Description:
Dice Rolling Freaks is an FREE Adventure Game that works well with a LOT of dice.  
Standard 6-sided dice.

Throughout the game, players' characters will work together (hopefuly!) to explore and survive an Interdimensional Dungeon, filled with bizarre monsters, lethal traps and unreal artifacts.

The general goal of the game is survival!!!

Characters start with 3 Character Dice, representing their equipment and abilities. These dice will be rolled frequently so their identities will change!

Tunnel Dice are used to map out the dungeon as the group explores, revealing surprising twists and turns, secret rooms and chambers, and monster encounters!

Encounters are cross-referenced with a simple online Monster List, and combat is fast and furious!

Advanced level of Dice Rolling Freaks includes Treasure Orbs, Unnatural Dead-Ends, Curses and more! DRF is always evolving with new rules and features!

—description from the publisher

Name: Diamantový les
Description:
Diamond Forest is a children's play by a Czech author with elements of remembering and strategy. Players in the role of dwarves in the dark forest, trying to find four colored diamonds. The game board always shows only a few squares at the same time, and players gradually explore it. In the Diamond Forest, there are treasures, adits, rocks, swamps, and devious imps waiting for dwarves.

—user summary

Name: Warfighter: Shadow War – Daylight Combat: PMC – Scenario Book #2
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal. Book of 23 Warfighter scenarios for Modern, Shadow War and Private Military Contractor. Not available for retail sale.

8.5" x 11" glossy paper booklet of 24 pages.

Name: Divorcio Express
Description:
A card game where we represent young recently graduated lawyers, who aspire to obtain the only vacancy of this monstrous company called Divorcios Express. Your only mission is to resolve divorces as quickly as possible and making your client have the least possible losses.
I play with a lot of interaction between players, steal and punish your competitors.
The game consists of 112 cards and 15 pawns in 5 different colors, 3 per player.
Includes 3 game modes:
Fast mode: approximately 7 minutes
Standard size: 25/30 minutes approx.
Advanced mode: 35/40 minutes approx.

In this card game you can perform three different actions or repeat them.
Draw a card from another player's hand.
Take a card from the deck or the card that is face up.
Play Divorce lawsuit.
Draw until you have 10 cards.
Discard a maximum of 5 cards and draw the same amount discarded.

The game ends when the draw deck is finished.

The player with the most prestige points wins, if they all end in negative points nobody wins the game.

Black-bordered cards are there to thwart the plans of the owner.
the cards with a red border are there to frustrate the rest of the players.
The green bordered cards are the cards you will play in your divorce lawsuit.
Cards with a gold border grant many points at the end of the game if you have them in hand at the end of the game (But be careful, fewer cards in hand are less cards to play and win points or to hinder other players)
Cards with a white border are only used in Advanced mode and provide the player who places his pawn on it with a special ability during that turn, a player cannot place on the same white card two turns in a row.

Un juego de cartas donde representamos a jóvenes abogados recién titulados, que aspiran a conseguir la única vacante de esta monstruosa empresa llamada Divorcios Express. Tu única misión es resolver divorcios de la manera más rápida posible y haciendo que tu cliente tenga las menos pérdidas posibles. 
Juego con muchísima interacción entre jugadores, roba y castiga a tus competidores.
El juego se compone de 112 cartes y 15 peones en 5 colores diferentes, 3 por jugador.
Incluye 3 modos de juego:
Modo rapido:          7 minutos aproximadamente
Mado standard:   25/30 minutos aprox.
Modo avanzado: 35/40 minutos aprox.

En este juego de cartas puedes realizar tres acciones diferentes o repetirlas.
Robar una carta de la mano de otro jugador.
Coger una carta del mazo o la carta que esta boca arriba.
Jugar Demanda de divorcio.
Robar hasta tener 10 cartas.
Descartar de un máximo de 5 cartas y robar la misma cantidad descartada.

El juego termina cuando se acaba el mazo de robo.

Gana el jugador con más puntos de prestigio, si todos acaban en puntos negativos nadie gana la partida.

Las cartas con borde negro estan para frustrar los planes del que las posee.
las cartas con borde rojo están para frustrar al resto de jugadores.
Las cartas con borde verde son las cartas que jugaras en tu demanda de divorcio.
Las cartas con borde dorado otorgan muchos puntos al final de la partida si las tienes en la mano al finalizar el juego (Pero cuidado, menos cartas en mano son menos cartas para jugar y ganar puntos o para entorpecer a otros jugadores)
Las cartas con borde blanco solo se usan en el modo Avanzado y proporcionan al jugador que coloca su peón sobre ella una habilidad especial durante ese turno, un jugador no puede colocarse en una misma carta blanca dos turnos seguidos.

Name: Prism
Description:
A trick-taking card game played with a 52-card deck in seven color strands numbered 2-7 and three types of wild card named INFRA-RED, ULTRAVIOLET, and SPECTRUM. One color strand is used per player.

Players are dealt 7 cards with a 3 card blind, and then take turns bidding based on how many tricks they think they can win.  Highest bidder gets the blind and must win as many tricks as he bid.  The highest bidder gains or loses points according to a formula based on whether he won his bid.  Other players can also score points for winning tricks.  First player to 100 points wins.

Name: Alone: Deep Expansion
Description:
Content:


     3 hero miniatures
     Character Cards
     4 boss miniatures
     Mission cards


The Alone - Deep Expansion includes 3 hero miniatures (with the corresponding character cards and 2 mission cards) and 4 boss creature miniatures (with the corresponding mission cards). The expansion also includes 5 special creature cards that can be used with the mob rules. They allow players to use miniatures of unique creatures in a different way. The special rules for rooms, on the other hand, give the hero player the opportunity to interact directly with the surroundings.

Name: Alone: Avatar Expansion
Description:
Content:


     2 hero miniatures
     Character Cards
     5 avatar creatures and cards
     Hero cards


The Alone Avatar Expansion includes 2 hero miniatures (with the corresponding character cards) and 5 avatar miniatures (with the corresponding avatar cards and special hero cards).

The expansion also includes the AVATAR rules, which add a new level to the gameplay. This time the evil side players move an AVATAR on the map and try to catch the hero in different ways, but be careful? the hero becomes more powerful every time the avatar strikes. This additional content expands the possibilities of the hero but also that of the "bad" players when creating their own scenarios and allows everyone to try out new scenarios.

Name: French Empire Series: Marengo
Description:
This historical game simulates a battle that took place on the 14th of June, 1800, in Marengo (northern Italy) between the army of the Austrian Empire, led by General Melas, and the French Republican army, led by General Bonaparte.

The game system is designed to be of medium complexity while remaining historically accurate. The rules, the map, the combat counters and the revolutionary use of dice have all been created with these goals in mind. The game also features no stacking of regiments, an innovative loss recording system and only minimal use of markers and tables. Two challenges are proposed: the French player, who begins the game in a position of numerical inferiority, must attempt to achieve the same feat as the army of General Bonaparte, to resist until the arrival of reinforcements, and then use these troops to seize victory. The Austrian player must try to do better than General Melas, who was overconfident of victory at 15:00, only to let it slip from his grasp..

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Absolute Dice
Description: Very simple family dice game. One dice determined the category for scoring, another determines how many attempts are given, and then the rest of the dice (6) are rolled to score. The eight dice come in a small velvet bag. Instructions are printed on the bag's tag.

Name: Absolute Dice: Word
Description:
Fun Word version of the original Absolute Dice. If you like words and word games this is a great little game in a highly accessible format that everyone can enjoy. Roll all the dice to start. A Category Die denotes which category of Words the player needs to make (Sport, Nature, Hobby, People, Animal or Wild), and the Number Die denotes how many turns a player has to achieve their target. The first player to score 101 points wins the game. Absolute Dice Word comes in it's own distinctive velvet pouch with a drawstring closure, lightweight and ideal to slip into a bag or pocket for travel or holidays Three ways to play. No Complicated Rules or special score sheets. It's easy, if you can spell, you can play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Absolute Dice: Sport
Description:
This is a themed version of Absolute Dice. Players take turns rolling dice. Just like in Absolute Dice, one die determines the category for scoring and another determines how many attempts are given. Then, six other dice are rolled to score. The only difference to Absolute Dice is that one of scoring dice has a silver icon and a gold icon, which double and triple the score, respectively.

The first player to reach 101 points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Absolute Dice: Kids
Description:
Very simple dice rolling and matching game. After a special die is rolled to determine the target category, and another die determines the amount of rolls, the remaining dice (6) are rolled for points. The dice features simple pictures to make it easy to spot matches. The eight dice come in a small velvet pouch which has the instructions attached as the tag.

—description from the publisher

This is a slightly simplified version of Absolute Dice.

Name: Belona
Description:
Belona is a fictional city inspired by all aspects of the Cyberpunk style. In this strategical 9 cards game, you will experience the rivalry between factions in the quest for domination of the city. In a simple game system, you can control a faction and take to the streets with groups under your command, seeking to dominate areas to gain skills, gain respect and influence, increase your resources and show rival factions that you are here to stay!

Each player controls a faction that is made up of groups. Each group moves around the board and can purchase items to increase their strength and then challenge opponents to combat. Each fight is resolved usually by rolling dice.

The winning faction is the one that dominates the most areas or defeats all groups of the enemy faction.

—description from the designer

Name: Medieval Royale
Description:
Sharpen your swords, shurikens, and wits to try to be the last-one-standing in this asymetrical, simultaneous, take-that BATTLE ROYALE board game for 4-9 players.

Watch out, the PLAGUE is closing in!

Set-up:

     Players choose a unique battler (Peasant, Princess, Ninja, Highwayman, and more, each with their own abilities, health (shown by heart tokens), and weapon deck).
     Choose a location where their battler will start on an ever shrinking medieval world.


GAMEPLAY:
The game is played over 12 short rounds each consisting of four phases:

PLAGUE- a plague card is revealed and placed in the displayed location. Any battler in that area loses one health (heart token).

COIN- a coin token in flipped over and placed in the specified location. The first battler to get to this location adds a unique weapon to their common weapons. But if two or more players arrive at the same time, a battle ensues and only the last person in that location gets the reward...

MOVEMENT- Each player secretly chooses one of their four movement tokens that specify direction of travel or if they want to stay where they are. All tokens are revealed at the same time and the players move into position for...

BATTLE- Battler may play a weapon to injur other battlers nearby. Some weapons damage battlers in the immediate location, some damage battlers in consecutive locations, and some have other advantages like damaging someone elsewhere on the map or getting more health.

When a battler is defeated (by losing all of their health), they are eliminated and the rival who dealt the final bow gets of of their remaining weapons.

More:
Medieval Royale takes 30-40 minutes from set-up till final triumph. Players are usually not eliminated until the last few rounds, so that eliminated players don't have to wait long to jump in on another game. Many games take longer and longer as rounds go on, but MR actually gets shorter and shorter, since fewer locations and weapons force a quick ending.

Characters, their abilities, and artwork is based on Of Knights and Ninjas- a medieval card game for 2-6 players that blurs the line between party and strategy game.

—description from the designer

Name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Road to Tokyo: October 1942 - July 1945
Description:
Road to Tokyo October 1942-July 1945 covers the war in the Pacific Theatre of Operations (PTO) from October 1942 to July 1945; the period when the Allies took the strategic initiative away from the Japanese.

Thirteen scenarios are included from the turn of the tide at Guadalcanal through to Okinawa, and not forgetting the battles in Burma and Borneo.

Rules for representing the environment and weapon systems that defined the PTO are included, along with information on the Japanese Army and 20 new Pacific fog of war cards.

This book allows you to join the fight and battle along the Road to Tokyo.
Families: Series: Command Decision, Test of Battle
